results.title: Beginning silk screening on fabric (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brenton Holmes, Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.) and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This program demonstrates the basic procedures for silk-screening on to fabric using paper stencils. Building a frame, attaching the silk, preparing stencils and making a two-colour print are shown

results.title: One hundred harvests
results.creator_credit: Robert Hesselschwerdt and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: A historical review of the work done on cereal breeding since the establishment of the Department of Agriculture in 1872. Includes shots of many old farming implements housed in the Historical Museum of Jeparit. Shows stages in the development of new varieties of wheat at Werribee Research Farm. Made in connection with centenary of the Department.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Hesselschwerdt and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: The Rigid Heddle Frame
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson, John Gray and Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Weaving”.
An instructional film on weaving for both beginners and more advanced weavers. In the rigid heddle frame, warp threads are passed through a slotted, wooden heddle instead of being attached to moving cords. Additional credits: photographer: Alan Grice ; script: Kay Donald ; editor: David Corke ; weaver and adviser: Erika Semler.

results.title: A Safe place
results.creator_credit: Anne Whitehead, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Robyn Cooney
results.brief_description: The prevention of child accidents in the home. Begins in the hospital, with the treatment of children in accidents, then broadens to a general look at the development of children in the first few years of growth, their capabilities, and perception of their environment, and potential for accident situations. Looks at ways of reducing risks to create a safe home environment.

results.title: The Lost 600
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, New South Wales. Dept. of Sport and Recreation and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety in, on and near the water”.
Emphasises the dangers associated with foolish, unsafe and reckless behaviour in and on the water. Among the many aspects of water safety covered are still-water drownings, surf safety, boating, yachting, water skiing, rock fishing and home pools.

results.title: Life Minus 3
results.brief_description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.
results.description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.

results.title: Hockey one hockey two
results.brief_description: Former Australian International Hockey player Margaret Pierce demonstrates basic skills. In this film Margaret demonstrates the three types of dribbling in Hockey-close, loose and Indian. Aimed at the beginner to intermediate hockey students to improve their skills

results.title: The Constant threat
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and John Gray
results.brief_description: The nature of foot and mouth disease, its manner of spreading, and the precautions taken to prevent the disease entering Australia. Note: A complementary production to ‘A continent on guard’

results.title: On Paper
results.creator_credit: Ray Harris, Michael Bongiovanni, Andrew Scollo, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
The connecting link in this video is photography, and the different approaches Micky Allan, Sally Robinson, Mandy Martin and Jenny Watson have to producing works on paper using photography either directly or indirectly

results.title: Tom Arthur
results.creator_credit: National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Tom Arthur’s art is for him a visual way of reasoning. By using the associated symbolic meanings and cultural connotations attached to specific objects and images he attempts to examine and question belief structures and systems of knowledge and how society forces these into its members. For Tom Arthur there are no absolutes, and everything seems relative
